title: Preben Arentoft
text:
Preben Arentoft (born 1 November 1942) is a Danish former <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player who played in the <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> position. He played professionally for a number of clubs, most notably <a href="Newcastle%20United%20F.C.">Newcastle United</a> and <a href="Blackburn%20Rovers%20F.C.">Blackburn Rovers</a>. He played nine games for the <a href="Denmark%20national%20football%20team">Denmark national football team</a>.
Biography.
Born in <a href="Copenhagen">Copenhagen</a>, Arentoft started playing football with Copenhagen club <a href="Br%C3%B8nsh%C3%B8j%20Boldklub">Brønshøj Boldklub</a>. He made his Danish national team debut in June 1965, and played four national team games while at Brønshøj. He moved abroad to play professionally for <a href="Scotland">Scottish</a> club <a href="Greenock%20Morton">Greenock Morton</a>. Due to the Danish rules of <a href="amateurism">amateurism</a>, he was no longer eligible for the Danish national team.
In 1969, Arentoft moved to <a href="England">England</a> to play for <a href="Newcastle%20United%20F.C.">Newcastle United</a>. He played for Newcastle until 1971, earning the nickname "Benny". He made a total of 63 appearances for the club, scoring 3 goals. He helped Newcastle win the <a href="Inter-Cities%20Fairs%20Cup">Inter-Cities Fairs Cup</a> in 1969, scoring in the second leg of the final. This made him the first Danish football player to win a European cup title. He is also remembered for having to play in goal during a 5-1 win over <a href="Manchester%20United%20F.C.">Manchester United</a> in 1970, coming on for an injured <a href="Willie%20McFaul">Willie McFaul</a>.
The rules of <a href="amateurism">amateurism</a> on the Danish national team was abandoned in 1971 before a game against Portugal. Preben Arentoft (representing <a href="Newcastle%20United%20F.C.">Newcastle United</a>) was picked, along with a handful of other players, to be the first professionals ever to participate on the national team. Denmark lost the game 5-0. He had another 4 caps that year to round up his career in the national team.
In 1971, he moved on to English club <a href="Blackburn%20Rovers%20F.C.">Blackburn Rovers</a>, before ending his career with <a href="Helsing%C3%B8r%20IF">Helsingør IF</a>.
